DataElement.preferredName: Observation Reuse Template Study Activity Target Anatomic Site Laterality Code ISO21090.CD.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded value specifying the side of the body (or a paired organ) that is a target site for an observation. EXAMPLE(S): bilateral, left, right

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Observation Reuse Template Study Activity Target Anatomic Site Laterality Code
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Watching something and taking note of what happens.:To use again.:Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective._An object fixed as a goal or point of examination; something to point at; a destination.:Named locations of or within the body.:Dominant use or manifestations of one side of the body versus the other; referring to a side of the body or of a structure.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Watching something and taking note of what happens.:To use again.:Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective.

Concepts.definition: Watching something and taking note of what happens.
Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.
